front.p: 1881 July 12: to Gore Museum of New Zealand—Te Papa Tongarewa MU000094/005/0201

body.p:
R.B. Gore, Esq
Secy. N.Z. Inst.,

I have to thank you for your kind (tho’ brief) note of the 29th. ulto., and for the 5 vols. of “Transactions” and 1 copy of T. Wood’s “Corals”, which quickly followed it: all arrived safely, and again I thank you for them.—

I now owe you for those books, and, also, one other extra vol. of “Trans.”, (vol. I.) sent me in May: and when I was in town this morning I very nearly got a P.O.O. for the sum of £6.6.0—but I timely recollected that I owe you something besides, viz.—for a small copy of Grasses (?) and, one of Broun’s “Coleoptera”, and, also, for this T. Wood’s “Corals”, and I do not know your charges for these, & I wish to pay you all that I owe you in the money way, and will do so immediately you let me know the total sum.
I also want some more Books from you—six copies of vol. xiii. “Trans.”, to be also paid for at once.—

Last evening we elected 5 new members, and our Council has directed me to purchase from you the extra vols. required: so please send me 6 copies as early as convenient. I hope you may have them to spare. I am,
